item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18697)
item.content:encoded:

Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=TayAndersonCO&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

* IF THERE IS A SNOW DAY *
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Snow Days are coming back ... well kinda ‚Ä¢ For a single snow...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Snow Days are coming back ... well kinda

‚Ä¢ For a single snow day, we will do a traditional snow day, with no in-person or remote learning.

‚Ä¢ If, due to weather, we are not able to safely allow students to attend in person for multiple days, then starting on the second day we will pivot to remote learning.

...

‚Ä¢ To support in planning for this shift, any time we are considering a potential snow day, we will send messaging to schools by mid-day the day before to remind students and teachers to prepare (such as by taking home computers) in the event that it becomes a multi-day event and we need to shift to a virtual model.

I am still working to end remote learning days for ALL snow days.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Community, This week I learned that students that are working...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Community,

This week I learned that students that are working REMOTELY must OPT-OUT of CMAS this year. If your student does not opt-out of CMAS then they will be expected to show up in-person to take the test. As of now we have roughly 7,800 students that have exercised their rights to opt-out of CMAS.

It is too late to opt-out via the parent portal, so you can use this email example to send to your school leader to opt your student out of testing. If you need help locating... the email to your school leader please put your school name in the comments.

Here is a simple way to opt-out your student for CMAS after today:

ENGLISH

Email subject: Opting Out of CMAS Testing

Dear Principal [insert Principal Name here],

I am writing to opt my student, [Student Full Name here], out of CMAS testing for the 2020-2021 school-year for philosophical reasons.

Thank you,
[Insert Your Full Name here]

SPANISH

Email subject: Opting Out of CMAS Testing

Dear Principal [Pon el nombre del Director aqu√≠],

I am writing to opt my student, [Pon el Nombre Completo de Estudiante Aqu√≠], out of CMAS testing for the 2020-2021 school-year for philosophical reasons.

Thank you,
[Pon el Nombre Completo del Padre/ Tutor Aqu√≠]

Signed,
Director Tay Anderson

See More

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: An 11-year-old student with autism was HANDCUFFED, GRABBED BY...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

An 11-year-old student with autism was HANDCUFFED, GRABBED BY HIS NECK, and was DETAINED for hours in Douglas County.

This is why I have no regrets removing police from our schools in Denver.

For those that are against our decision in Denver Public Schools you condone what happened to this 11-year-old.

The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate wrote on him with a marker in a Douglas County middle school, according to the ACLU.

9news.com

11-year-old boy with autism handcuffed at school, mom sues district, sheriff's office

The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate wrote on him with a marker in a Douglas County middle school, according to the ACLU.The boy poked a classmate with a pencil after the classmate wrote on him with a marker in a Douglas County middle school, according to the ACLU.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: We must provide dyslexia screenings for all students in...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

We must provide dyslexia screenings for all students in Kindergarten and First Grade and that is why I am going to team up with DenCoKID to make this a reality.

I will also be donating a portion of my annual school board budget to support with the pilot program.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

As we celebrate international women‚Äôs day let‚Äôs remember trans-women are women.

Today I am uplifting a Black woman that was a true fighter for equity and that is Marsha P. Johnson.

#internationalwomensday2021

item.title: Opt-out rates are HIGH in Denver Public Schools, I just received...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Opt-out rates are HIGH in Denver Public Schools, I just received word that one school had over 90% of their students opt-out of standardized tests!

We are on track to having the largest opt-out movement in Denver Public Schools history.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Congratulations Principal Lynch! I am excited to work with you...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Congratulations Principal Lynch!

I am excited to work with you to build a Montbello for the students.

After a thoughtful and thorough hiring process, we are excited to announce that Ms. Neisa Lynch has been selected as the principal of the new Montbello High School slated to open in the 2022-23 school year. Ms. Lynch will begin a year-zero planning year to engage the community, hire staff, design th...
